Today in the middle of a pandemic a week after losing an election President Trump urged the Supreme Court to upend health care for families across the country.  Democrats tried repeatedly to stop this dangerous partisan attack but all Republicans have done is cheer it on.
Learn more about how and where to get a COVID-19 test if you’ve been in contact with someone who has tested positive or have symptoms. https://t.co/SlH1uFdcyy

The GOP aren't taking the health & economic consequences of this pandemic seriously & their Senate LHHS bill is the latest example. I oppose this bill & will push for one that actually helps families & communities deal with the challenges they’re facing. https://t.co/GINwLmHRgg

Under the new Admin I will continue pushing for steps to not only repair the damage Republicans have done over the last 4 years but to ensure that no matter where you live what you make or who you are—you can get the health care you need without worrying about the cost.

I’m watching with concern as Republicans make their partisan case to a Supreme Court they have filled with anti-health care Justices but I want people who share those concerns to know one thing: we will never stop standing up for your health care.

Unfortunately the Trump Admin is ignoring the will & wellbeing of families & still urging SCOTUS to strike down protections for people with pre-ex conditions rip away health coverage millions of families rely on & upend care for people across the country—all during a pandemic.

Last week the American people made clear they want to turn the page on the era of endless Republican attacks on their health care & overwhelmingly elected a new President who believes health care should be a right not a privilege.
Today the difference between the outgoing Trump Administration and the incoming Biden Administration on health care—the path the American people rejected and the future they chose—is on full display.

Republicans will be at SCOTUS this week defending their lawsuit to: - end pre-ex protections - reopen the Medicare doughnut hole - end caps on patient's costs - take away guaranteed coverage for essential care - and more  It's time to stop these harmful attacks.

10 million+ people and rising have been infected with COVID-19 in the U.S. If Republicans have their way at the Supreme Court insurance companies could treat COVID-19 as a pre-ex condition and charge those who have been infected more or even deny them coverage.

By quickly announcing an expert panel to advise his transition President-elect Biden is showing he takes this crisis seriously & is prepared to do the hard work necessary to keep our country safe and chart a course out of this pandemic. https://t.co/JH13fcVcIa

A lot has happened over the last week but here's one thing that hasn't changed:  Republicans are still arguing at the Supreme Court tomorrow to end protections for patients with pre-ex conditions strike down health care for millions of people and send costs skyrocketing.
As I've said before we desperately need a national comprehensive plan to ensure we can widely and equitably distribute a safe effective trusted vaccine that is free for all.

There's a lot going on but we can't lose sight of the fact that the COVID-19 pandemic isn't over and is getting worse. Families workers and communities need support to stay safe and healthy and get through this crisis—and I'll keep fighting in the Senate until they get it.

Reminder: the Republican lawsuit to dismantle the ACA and take away critical protections for patients with pre-ex conditions end Medicaid expansion and more is being heard at the Supreme Court on Tuesday.   We've got to rest then get back in the fight to #ProtectOurCare.

As the election results have rolled in this week the COVID-19 crisis has also continued to rage with record-breaking case counts. This pandemic will not go away on its own—everyone needs to do their part to wear a mask social distance & follow local public health guidelines.

Our country has an incredible amount of work ahead of us. But as this victory shows we can rise to the most difficult tests when we come together & act on our belief in creating a better fairer future for all. I can't wait to take up the work ahead with a Biden-Harris Admin.
No matter what the President wrongly and desperately claims in the coming days the voters spoke clearly. President Trump decisively lost a legitimate election.

Unfortunately President Trump and his allies have already decided to attack the results instead of respect them. This is a disgraceful decision that every person who truly values our democracy will stand firmly against.

In particular as the grandmother of 2 young girls who have seen Kamala as a role model I’m smiling today about the history Kamala has made & about all the parents telling their children “See you can too!” as she becomes our first woman Black & Indian-American VP.

Because of Joe & Kamala and because of every one of you who didn’t just hope but acted on that hope—who got involved organized and voted—we are further on our way to a future where justice dignity and opportunity are a reality for each and every one of us.

Joe and Kamala are true public servants who understand the immense challenges workers and families are experiencing because they’ve lived many of those same challenges—and they have the vision and drive to bring us together around solutions.
American voters spoke and I am thrilled to congratulate Joe Biden and Kamala Harris on being elected our next President and Vice President.

I want Senate Republicans to know the consequences of this vote will be felt long after this President is gone from office—regardless of the outcome of this election.   People across the country will not forget. And neither will your Democratic colleagues.

Instead Republicans will have a simple choice.   Will they listen to the people who are telling them in no uncertain terms that if you put this judge on the court—if you win this partisan lawsuit—it could kill me?  Or will they ignore them?

The bottom line is that this Supreme Court fight isn’t about politics—it’s about the lives of hundreds of millions of people who could lose their health care and see their fundamental rights protections and opportunities rolled back if Republicans succeed.

People are worried about their health care their marriages their rights even their lives. I’m sharing their stories on the Senate floor so Republicans have no excuse for pretending not to hear them or know what’s at stake.

Watching Republicans ignore the clear wishes of the American people explicitly reject attempts to help families and communities get through this pandemic and press on with this grotesque power grab is a new low for this body for our country and for the people we serve.

Let's not forget that all this is happening in the middle of a pandemic—and instead of working with Democrats to pass serious relief communities are calling out for Republicans are refusing to do anything but jam this anti-health care judge on to the Supreme Court.

Speaking now on the Senate floor against Republicans’ Supreme Court charade. We should not be voting on this nominee while the American people themselves are voting on how they want this country's future to look.  https://t.co/7PpZdo252m
